website_summaries.verdict: A drywall lift that does the job while being much more affordable than professional lifts.
pros: Handles up to 150 pounds and 4-by-16-foot drywall sheets
Maximum lift height for ceilings is 11 feet
cons: The wheels are difficult to move and the unit itself can be a little wobbly

customer_reviews.title: What a wonderful invention
customer_reviews.text: I was tasked with remodeling the basement before our baby arrived, and could not have completed it as quickly as I did without this lift. It was in 3 pieces when I got it out of the package, and putting it together was very easy. The crank wheel and main support is very heavy. Very intuitive interface, and easy tear down. This literally takes all the "grunt work" of lifting drywall out of your hands. Just align, lift, and screw into place (or use nails, if you're a heathen). I will most likely never need this lift again, so my initial thought was to just sell it afterwards, but I'm having a hard time letting it go to be honest.
customer_reviews.author: MTH

customer_reviews.title: The device is very wobbly and the break lever broke ...
customer_reviews.text: The device is very wobbly and the break lever broke during the first use. The box was very heavy and arrived damaged, so there was no way of getting it back in the box to return it. Plus, I would have had to haul it to the UPS store. I kept it and jerry-rigged a lever, but I didn't find the original product worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy G

customer_reviews.title: Wide footprint makes use in small rooms with floor obstructions difficult, but is a godsend once it is in position
customer_reviews.text: My father and I used this panel hoist to put drywall up on the ceiling (10') of his bathroom and it made the difference between an impossible headache of a project and a manageable, though difficult one. The bathroom was full of tight corners and obstructions (i.e. toilet, tub) that made getting the hoist into position difficult given its wide footprint, but once it was there, it raised the drywall pieces without issue and held them in place while we put in the fasteners. We have a lot more work to do in that house and are confident that this hoist will continue to serve us well.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the one man operation.
customer_reviews.text: I remember the days of yesteryear where I could throw sheets of drywall around like they were pieces of paper, as reality sinks in this lift became indispensable with my shop build project. No longer can I hold a sheet of dry wall balanced with one hand and on my head and fasten to the ceiling also the speed of drywall being placed has slowed to an unacceptable speed for which is why I purchased this lift instead of renting, I could of purchased two or three by the time I finished the drywall portion of the build.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Joeshmoe

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The product we received appeared to be used. It does not roll very well. The buttons to control the length of the arms sometimes require a screwdriver to pull them open. The cable often slips when raising the lift. The lift works but I would not purchase the product again and cannot recommend purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney Egnew

customer_reviews.title: Big and strong
customer_reviews.text: Awsome. Cannot goo without it for ceilings especially. I laid 12ft sheets with no problemsand especially if you glue the drywall the lift is mandatory. So do spend the money it is well worth it. Assembles pretty fast and sane goes for disassembly. You won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Gyongyver Andreiovici

customer_reviews.title: Serviceable, with the usual corners cut in the name of price
customer_reviews.text: This lift is a good value, but be aware that it is a VALUE lift. Tolerances are wide and the welds are adequate but by no means pretty. Most annoying are the garbage wheel casters. Not smooth at all, and would much rather drag the wheel sideways in the direction you want to go than actually allow the wheel to swivel. All that in mind, it gets the job done. Just be aware that you haven't stumbled across some magical bargain (actually, at the current price it's not so magical anyway). This is $150 worth of drywall lift, which is about what I paid for it. Wouldn't pay more.
customer_reviews.author: D. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: The functionality is amazing because you can adjust the stand to put it ...
customer_reviews.text: This makes hanging drywall on the ceiling a breeze especially when working by yourself. The functionality is amazing because you can adjust the stand to put it corner to corner with the drywall that is already attached.
customer_reviews.author: Onlineshopper105

customer_reviews.title: Good deal.
customer_reviews.text: It works great. The only complaints I have are when the cable winds around as you are going up with wood, the cable slips off the cable already spooled and gives a wicked THUNK that is freaky loud and jars the unit. The other thing is the wheel locks are so-so for holding the unit. But, bang for the buck, a good deal. Renting meant getting the whole garage done in one or two days. NOPE! I'll take my time and do a couple of sheets a nite.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Tom

customer_reviews.title: This really is the Best Choice!
customer_reviews.text: After using this monster to hang 12 footers and 10 footers on a nine foot ceiling in a large basement, I'm gladly going with five stars, as this was truly a pleasure to work with. It surely must be well-designed because assembly was a snap, or should I say several snaps, because it literally snaps together from the easy to follow eight-page instruction manual. Large casters made moving and positioning it easy, even when fully loaded, and there were no problems working the wheel-crank and wench assembly. Thank you Best Choice!
customer_reviews.author: Old Eagle Eye

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and useful
customer_reviews.text: It's a drywall Jack for less than $150. With that in mind, I would recommend this product if you have at least a few rooms to drywall. It was useful and I don't regret the purchase. However, I bent it on the first sheet I hung. Had to straighten the piece throughout the day, then welded some angle steel on to the piece to give it more structure. Seems to be fine now, but I'm not sure how long it will last. Not a high quality tool, but priced accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kepler

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for a DIY job
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for a DIY job. A local store was going to rent me the Same thing for the same exact price, so I took a chance with this one. I will say it does squeak and yes I did put some lithium grease on it. I used 12 foot sheets with it and it performed very well. Only thing is that there is some compliance in the arms especially with longer sheets , but didn't hold me back from getting the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Dp

customer_reviews.title: Works great for plywood
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to help with the construction of our house addition. Great for holding up the plywood for ceiling and higher wall areas. Was a great help! (I did not personally use this, but my guys gave me their opinion and are happy to have it!)
customer_reviews.author: rendachs

customer_reviews.title: why rent when you can buy!
customer_reviews.text: home improvement stores rent this for 140/week. i needed this for more than a week so this was a no brained. you can install drywall yourself with this device. a must have for anyone doing large home improvement projects involving drywall.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wong

customer_reviews.title: For This Price, It's Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I have rented a number of these over the years and never looked at buying one because of the price. I had a few different ceiling jobs coming up around the same time and for the price, I figured if it was broken at the end of the third job, I would still have saved money over renting. But it is way more than that. Is it the quality of the rental units? No, but it's not far off.
customer_reviews.author: Tod Moses

customer_reviews.title: sliced bread
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made china tool but it WORKS. All those years carrying drywall up ladders or onto benches and holding with my head. Should have bought one years ago although I usually sub out all my drywall work. I'm rocking my new shop right now and it's 1000 sq feet with 10 ceilings and this is worth it for just this one job and about the price of a week rental from local (30 miles away) rental place.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Good buy. Sturdy product!
customer_reviews.text: Great except the box was damaged and a couple of parts were missing. The handle that fits onto the lift pulley was one. I can live without it, but its a pain. When I reported it, Amazon was fine for me to return it, but I opted just to keep it and save the shipping cost. Can beat the price ... wish I had bought one about 500 ceiling sheets ago!!!
customer_reviews.author: 2204rob

customer_reviews.title: Did my entire house and it still works awesome. It will be around for future jobs for ...
customer_reviews.text: This rinky dink little china lift makes impossible drywall jobs simple. Used it to lift 12' 5/8'' drywall sheets weighing 102 pounds. Did my entire house and it still works awesome. It will be around for future jobs for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: caleb

customer_reviews.title: Great for a DIYer
customer_reviews.text: I don't make a living off of hanging drywall, so it is not too often I am doing it. Having said that, I wish I bought this product years ago. It is cheaper in quality, but it makes drywalling ceilings a breeze. It works great with angled ceilings as well. For a DIYer, you can't beat it for the price. It also easily assembles and disassembled for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: worked great. Just as sturdy as rental units
customer_reviews.text: worked great. Just as sturdy as rental units. a must have if you are hanging ceiling drywall especially for the price. I found assembly easy and raises and lowers with ease. works as expected for a cheap price. Nothing is rock solid and any 3 leg jack you have to pay attention to where and how you possition it.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: This was not the best sheetrock lift out there, but for the price it worked great. I purchased it to sheetrock my garage and shop. I wanted to take my time so a rental was too expensive. After finishing the project, I sold it. It ended up saving me money vs a rental and allowed me to work at my own pace.
customer_reviews.author: John Holland

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for our DYI ceiling renovation. It was small and manageable for a husband and wife team of 2. Built well enough to provide us what we needed especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: The wheels suck.
customer_reviews.text: This worked for what I needed it for, but the wheels suck. They don't turn well at all. Everything else was fine. It's cheap and good for a few jobs occasionally, but I would not use it everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Coburn

customer_reviews.title: Huge Help!
customer_reviews.text: What an amazing tool. This is like having 2 people helping you by holding the sheet rock up while you get it secured. A must have for anyone who has to work alone most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Houghton

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a major remodel flr less than I can rent one. Well built and preassembled (mostly). Took less than 10 mins to have it up and running.
customer_reviews.author: The_Truth

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: This back saving device is worth its weight in Golden! My husband loves it as he can put up Sheetrock by himself. I love it because I don’t hear as much swearing while he is sheetrocking. Seems to be very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Makes DIY drywall possible when you're alone.
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm. I was able to hang drywall, solo, in a 400 square foot addition. Works as advertised, easy to use. At this price, it sure beats rentals.
customer_reviews.author: William Ames

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Such a great tool to have for renovation. Totally worth the money just for one room and I have 3 to go. Also used it to install some custom ceiling beams. Handled 10 ft 5/8 drywall sheets no problem.
customer_reviews.author: David Kersten

customer_reviews.title: Did the trick. I needed it for 8 pieces ...
customer_reviews.text: Did the trick. I needed it for 8 pieces of drywall for my garage. I sold it for 10 bucks more than I paid for it on Craigslist once I was done.
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money! Turns drywalling into a one man job!
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the money! I’m remodeling my house and have been using the hoist to hang 12’ sheets of drywall by myself. Worth purchasing even if you only plan to use for one project.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher E.

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works fantastic! I was worried about buying a very inexpensive drywall lift, but it's great quality. We never could have finished our garage without it. We had a contractor come over to quote another job as we were using it, and he commented that it was identical to his $500 drywall lift. Don't hesitate to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Pillion

customer_reviews.title: Great Price and a great product
customer_reviews.text: Great Price and a great product! we are finishing our basement, and this thing is truly a life saver! I am no expert, but was able to put it all together in under 20 minutes... is that too long? not for me :-/
customer_reviews.author: Madam Zu Zu

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Husband said it made the job easier however it is weird to maneuver and it would be better if it went lower to place drywall piece on but good all in all for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Great item for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great item for the price. Used it one time to do a ceiling then turned around and sold it for $30 less. Beats renting one and I kept it as long as I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Keith E. Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works good for for 1/2 " drywall, a little light weight for 5/8 " drywall. great value though.
customer_reviews.author: mark /nebraska

customer_reviews.title: As with all good tools, this easily pays for itself in time ...
customer_reviews.text: Makes installing overhead panels so much easier! As with all good tools, this easily pays for itself in time and effort saved. I would purchase this lift even for installing drywall in a single room (though it may be better to rent one for such limited use).
customer_reviews.author: D.B.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Was missing the handle. Box had a lot of damage. Device works as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Louise Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Makes life easier
customer_reviews.text: This thing is like buying another pair of arms! I am finishing my basement and after my cousin and I attempted to place a couple of panels of drywall on the ceiling, we quickly realized we aren't pros and we need something to make this easier. So I bought this and I stopped calling my cousin to come help. This is a 1 man drywalling machine. It even lets you place drywall horizontally on your walls. Now my cousin just comes over to drink beer and watch me do a 2 man job by myself! It is heavy though, and you need a pretty good amount of space to maneuver it around.
customer_reviews.author: Stonewall

customer_reviews.title: Works as a diy
customer_reviews.text: I had to YouTube a video to figure out how to use it, no instructions in the box. I used it and didn't have any problem hanging drywall on walls and ceiling by myself.
customer_reviews.author: anthony

customer_reviews.title: Good drywall lift for home owner remodeling projects
customer_reviews.text: Very nice dry wall lift for reasonable price. The lift easily breaks down for moving/storage. Works great, not heavy duty for continous everyday use, but works great for casual use. Speedy delivery with prime.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: This is really helpful for working overhead.
customer_reviews.text: So far I like everything about this unit, makes my job a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: Martin gallegos

customer_reviews.title: Better than lifting that’s for sure It’s heavy and a ...
customer_reviews.text: Better than lifting that’s for sure It’s heavy and a little hard to maneuver in small spaces but definitely worth the money when you are by yourself.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: A real back saver
customer_reviews.text: Have only used it for a small project so far. It is a back saver, especially on 12 X 4 foot sheets on the ceiling. The instruction book was a little fuzzy, but I figured it out. The thing squeaks when cranking it, but I will try some WD40. I could use some guidance on lubrication if anyone out there knows.
customer_reviews.author: Rich The Crooner

customer_reviews.title: but once you do it works great, though you do have to get used to ...
customer_reviews.text: I found it rather difficult to get 5/8" drywall up onto the the hoist, but once you do it works great, though you do have to get used to the scary sound it makes at one point while you're cranking the board up to the ceiling. It's a "must have" for anyone planning to hang a drywall ceiling by himself.
customer_reviews.author: michael lerner

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I bought on of these 18 years ago ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I bought on of these 18 years ago and paid a lot more than this time this is the exact same model loved it then love it now
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Look at the photo and it assembles easy. I have only used it once but it ...
customer_reviews.text: First thing you should do is throw away the instructions ( if you have a mechanical mind) they are awful. Look at the photo and it assembles easy. I have only used it once but it was smooth and well designed
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Cody

customer_reviews.title: Best money I have ever spent
customer_reviews.text: This drywall lift has been a life saver. I have hung every bit of drywall in my fixer upper all by my self, thanks to this lift. Best money I have ever spent.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: This saved us a ton of time, headaches and money. Not hard to use at all worked great.
customer_reviews.author: nick sorrentino

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Works, but a bit flimsy. Most worried about the cable and brake system, feels really cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Ashford

customer_reviews.title: It was great..
customer_reviews.text: It was great...saved a lot of heavy lifting....Put a ceiling up of OSB and that weighs a lot...got here when they said and was easy to put together i would buy here again...great product
customer_reviews.author: Bob Swearingen

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive and works well for small project needs. Quite sturdy! Easily broken down into three parts for somewhat bulky storage. Buying this was cheaper than renting and gives me the time to be a perfectionist and get my drywall up over the course of several weekends. My only foreseeable issue will be storing it after I'm done.
customer_reviews.author: Lefty

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Very Impressed, Better than expected, High Quality, Easy to use, Sturdy, Easy to maneuver, Asked a question and had an immediate response from customer service. Thank You.
customer_reviews.author: sean

customer_reviews.title: Flawless and as expected
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lift back in October because I was remodeling my whole house. The lift made it easy to hang all the Sheetrock myself. It worked flawlessly and as expected. I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Norm Boulier

customer_reviews.title: Happy user
customer_reviews.text: While the packaging was beaten up, the unit was fully functional. A quick assembly and it works as advertised. Seems to be a quality tool.
customer_reviews.author: Best Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Made Hanging 1/2 inch osb on 10 foot ceiling In garage easy for one person
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Works great. A+++
customer_reviews.text: Item works great. Have installed 5/8" drywall on the ceiling of the garage under my house. Did it by myself with no help. Would definitely recommend it. Lowest price I have found anywhere. Free shipping and no tax made it even better.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES R SIEGEL

customer_reviews.title: Panel hoist
customer_reviews.text: I used this to lift the drywall to the ceiling on a home remodeling project that I was working on by myself. It did a great job without enlisting help from anyone. Exactly what it is designed to do. I looked at several sources for this purchase and found this to be the lowest price. The quality is pretty good for a home project but if you are a contractor I would recommend spending the extra cash for a higher quality lift.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Product works great, but it was destroyed in shipping
customer_reviews.text: Product works great, but it was destroyed in shipping, barely even in a box anymore. Don’t expect it to arrive pretty.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: It can be more heavy duty but like I said it works great...
customer_reviews.text: Very very easy to assemble and works great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Darius Garvin

customer_reviews.title: It is sketchy, but did the job putting up ...
customer_reviews.text: It is sketchy, but did the job putting up 12 foot sheets of 5/8 in my 24 x 60 foot garage. Cheaper than renting one. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Stephen

customer_reviews.title: worthless
customer_reviews.text: brake did not work paint was all scratched when I received it
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Functions flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: Jack did what it was supposed to (hanging drywall in a remodel by myself). Beats holding it up with your head by a landslide.
customer_reviews.author: John Van

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works good,,, not great. It will get the job done for private use, I probably wouldn't use it professionally.
customer_reviews.author: tra miller

customer_reviews.title: Helpful tool
customer_reviews.text: It helped hang about 20 sheets of 4' x 8' drywall in a DIY project. It's not perfect but I was alone in this project. It did what I needed it to do. Now that I'm done with this tool I'm confident I can get some of my money back by selling it on Craigslist.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Velie

customer_reviews.title: Tool arrived with a broken wheel
customer_reviews.text: The wheels were thin plastic in the center where the shaft supported the weight of the hoist. I replaced the wheels with 6" wheels with metal centers from Home Depot. Cost was 28$ for three wheels. Works fine now. Little disapointed that the hoist had 1 broken wheel when delivered.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Got wobble
customer_reviews.text: Should have bought one 20 years ago. Works great but has its wobble.
customer_reviews.author: mike in kansas

customer_reviews.title: Works excelent and well made. Old Fire Chief
customer_reviews.text: I received the lift and found it well made and did the job I needed it for. There was a issue on shipping to my address but was refunded in full the amount I had paid for it and I reordered the same unit and it arrived on time and was packed very well. Being a older man I have to work smarter not harder. I would recommend this lift to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Rickie M.

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper to buy than to rent.
customer_reviews.text: I ended up using my workbench to hang the ceiling. A sheetrock bench etc is way faster with 2 people. However, if you're alone or if you're not very strong this is a great alternative.
customer_reviews.author: AbsoluteRock

customer_reviews.title: Great tool. Just will not work in narrow places ...
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Just will not work in narrow places like a hallway or bathroom. You need lots of real estate to use this.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Swarts

customer_reviews.title: Back saver!
customer_reviews.text: What a back saver! It made doing my kitchen ceiling infinitely easier. It wobbly though and that would be my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Canada

customer_reviews.title: it helps but could be better
customer_reviews.text: Its good for the price and all, but its by no means the silver bullet that makes solo drywalling a cinch. First, its kind of rickety, and I don't like when the crank pops part way through cranking the wheel that raises the drywall. I also got frustrated with the situations where the board would pop off the handles. Also the black ends of the device will actually leave black marks on your drywall. Maybe this would work better for ceilings, but I'm working walls, and I don't see how I could take better advantage of the mechanical advantage it's supposed to provide.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Average

customer_reviews.title: Hung 60 4x12 sheets on 8' high ceilings no problems ...
customer_reviews.text: Hung 60 4x12 sheets on 8' high ceilings no problems. Young guys can put Sheetrock up faster without the lift,but I'm 60 and couldn't have done it without the lift. Now looking to buy the extention to hang a 14' ceiling in our church. Well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: mark best

customer_reviews.title: Great helper
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly. It makes it possible to install sheet rock by yourself.The instructions could have been better but it is not very hard to figure out. It is easy to put together. And easy to take apart for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Bob H

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Made short work of installing my steel ceiling panels.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Hoth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good for your back. Saves a ton of time. Makes working alone great!
customer_reviews.author: Dhayes2

customer_reviews.title: Great price but not the best out there
customer_reviews.text: Great price but not the best out there. Gets the job done but the cable will probably need to be replaced after extended use
customer_reviews.author: James VanDerWerf

customer_reviews.title: ... but for the average project guy this thing is great.
customer_reviews.text: Not quite professional grade but for the average project guy this thing is great.
customer_reviews.author: Blair Neal

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great piece of equipment to have. It makes hanging drywall so much easier
customer_reviews.author: Hammer

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lift for my husband and he has back problems and this has relieved him from asking for help and he is eager to do things for himself.he was very impressed on how strong and sturdy the metal was. He was amazed on how tall and easy he was able to lift the sheetrock. We are planning to use it to hang siding for an out building. I cant stop him.. :) Thank You A pleased customer and husband
customer_reviews.author: Wife'

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to assemble and helps make hanging drywall a breeze! It would have taken at least twice as long to hang the drywall without it.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Kay

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have been a contractor for 20 years. Wish I would have bought this sooner. Great quality and easy to set up/use.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: little wobbly but does the job . a lot easier than lifting by hand.
customer_reviews.author: James K.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not very strong but extremely handy when working alone. Does the job designed to do
customer_reviews.author: Ms_Mo

customer_reviews.title: very worthwhile
customer_reviews.text: Very securely wrapped, for sure! Assembled without any problems. Works smoothly and does the job, just as described. So much easier than lifting by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Stansell

customer_reviews.title: everything assembled easily and worked properly
customer_reviews.text: This is a four-star review because the lift arrived in a completely mangled box with holes punched through it from the parts inside. The manufacturer had a single piece of bubble wrap inside, which did absolutely nothing to pad parts and keep them from getting scratched / dinged. Otherwise, everything assembled easily and worked properly, which is the important part. I have about 50 sheets of 7/16" OSB to place and will update this review when the job is complete.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Did 1200 sq ft on my own with this, worked great with 12ft drywall
customer_reviews.author: Cole1512

customer_reviews.title: Not disappointed with the product
customer_reviews.text: Product works well. I received a mostly destroyed box with a used lift. Not disappointed with the product, just the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Steven L Ericksen

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: worked as advertised but was missing the rubber feet for the stop legs.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Poliing

customer_reviews.title: I rented this same lift for 20 for a week ...
customer_reviews.text: I rented this same lift for 20 for a week the wood of sold it to me for 450 have a lot of dry wall to put in my house will save me a lot from renting
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Mullaney

customer_reviews.title: I love this tool
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool! It makes installing a Sheetrock ceiling quick and easy! It saves me time , money and frustration!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great lift to diy
customer_reviews.text: Great drywall lift for the price. Breaks down and stores nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK machine would buy again
customer_reviews.text: good machine, however you have to lift the drywall panel too high to get it on the lift. I'm 6' tall and found it difficult to lift a panel up onto the lift. It would be nice if the lift hooks weren't so high. You also need someone to hold the lift arms in place while you set the drywall on the arms. Once it's on the arm it lifts easily and works great. I've only used in a small bathroom where it was hard to maneuver, I'm sure when I do a large room it will be much easier. For the money it's pretty good. No where near as nice as a $600 unit but then it's really inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: jim owen

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Very impressive, super heavy. I was expecting something cheap, it's not... very well built
customer_reviews.author: Sam W.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: This has been awesome. Easy setup/take-down. Easy to maneuver, easy to hang 10' sheetrock on the ceiling.
customer_reviews.author: TaxTech

customer_reviews.title: Work!!
customer_reviews.text: It arrived quickly and assembly was a piece of cake.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for what I needed,hanging 8 sheets of drywall on a 10' ceiling. Very east to set up and move around. I was impressed!
customer_reviews.author: A Kansan

customer_reviews.title: Best father's day present
customer_reviews.text: We are hanging sheetrock in our basement. This was perfect. Easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: sherry

customer_reviews.title: look good
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and remove, do the job which make my life so easy installing the dry wall, easy to move around.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality dry wall hoist
customer_reviews.text: Hoist delivered promptly exactly as described. Worked perfectly, used to lift 4 x 12 foot dry wall sheets to 11 foot high ceiling. Easy, minimal assembly. Easy break down for transport and or storage.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Made sheetrocking the ceiling of my garage very easy!!
customer_reviews.author: S  J

product_meta.title: Best Choice Products Drywall Panel Jack Hoist Lift Construction Tool w/ 11ft Reach, Locking Caster Wheels, Winch
product_meta.description: Best Choice Products is proud to present our brand new Drywall Lift. You can get your drywall projects done more effectively with the lift and no more need to carry the bulky and oddly shaped drywall. The lift is forged from heavy duty steel, which ensures it longer lasting life and sturdiness. Easy to assemble, the lift can be used in relatively no time after you wrap your hands around this beauty. The payload is up to a robust 150 lbs. and can be hoisted up on walls or ceilings. The base contains three wheels and helps keep the system balanced, enabling the lift to make the job as easy as possible. Grab this for your next drywall projects before they are all gone! NEW PRODUCT WITH FACTORY PACKAGING Get your drywall projects done more effectively with the lift and no more need to carry the bulky and oddly shaped drywall Lift is forged from heavy duty steel, which ensures it longer lasting life and sturdiness The payload is up to a robust 150 lbs. and can be hoisted up on walls or ceilings Base contains three wheels and helps keep the system balanced Product Dimensions: 48"(L) x 48"(W) x 69"(H) SPECIFICATIONS 150 lbs load limit; 5” caster wheels for easy rolling; Built-in winch with brake; Single sheet capacity: 4' x 16'; Horizontal ceilings minimum: 4'; Horizontal ceilings maximum: 11'; Product weight: 88.5 lbs.
feature_bullets: DO-IT-YOURSELF: Easily install sheets and panels of drywall to walls and ceilings without the need for additional help from others
VERSATILE USAGE: Personal use at home for bedroom, bathroom, and kitchen renovations or commercial use for larger scale projects
SIMPLE OPERATION: Built-in winch handle with brake allows you to easily crank sheets and panels up to a ceiling up to 11 feet in height
STURDY AND STRONG: Heavy-duty steel frame and base is built for durability while the three 5-inch wheels ensure that the unit is easily movable
OVERALL DIMENSIONS: 48"(L) x 48"(W) x 69"(H); Weight Capacity: 150 lbs.
